result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy L Nerison was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Barron County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
With good time.
2 days jail credit.
Must report to the Barron County Jail within 30 minutes after court.

Attorney Fees To Be Determined.
Financial obligations are due within 60 days of the sentence date. The Barron County Clerk of Courts shall collect all financial obligations. In the event of non-payment of outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Order for DNA given to defendant in court.  Must report to the Barron County Jail immediately to submit DNA sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy L Nerison

records.addlTxt: Order for payment approving attorney fees - $320.00

10:37 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jeremy L Nerison in court.  Attorney Laura Ann Sutton in court for Jeremy L Nerison. 

10:38  Court relates and gives appearances.
10:38  State relates and puts agreement on record.
10:39  Court questions defendant.
10:41  Atty. Sutton relates.
10:41  Defendant relates.
10:41  Court relates.

Count #1:  Defendant pleads guilty; Court finds factual basis to accept plea and finds defendant guilty of same.

Count #2:  Defendant pleads guilty; Court finds factual basis to accept plea and finds defendant guilty of same.

Pay costs; 60 days to pay.
5 days jail (on count #1) with good time; and with credit for 2 days served.  Report within next 1/2 hr.
Order for DNA given to defendant in court. Must report to the Barron County immediately to submit DNA sample.

Copy of Minute Sheet given to defendant in court.

(MS scanned to jail)

2:32 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jeremy L Nerison in court.  Attorney Laura Ann Sutton in court for Jeremy L Nerison. 
Attorney Sutton relates she just received discovery and believes there will be a resolution.  Plea date set before Judge Babler.  Address and phone number confirmed.  Bond continues.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:15 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jeremy L Nerison appeared by video.  Attorney Laura Ann Sutton appeared by video for Jeremy L Nerison. 
Formal reading of complaint waived. Not guilty pleas entered. 
Must appear in person.
Hearing scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Attorney fees.  Laura Sutton appointed.  Repay $50.00 per month starting 05/01/2022.
Laura Sutton appointed.  Repay $50.00 per month starting 05/01/2022.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473. 

Defendant must have no contact with D.I.T. dob 11/19/2004.

10:09 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jeremy L Nerison in court. 

Defendant must call the public defender's office to determine eligibility (phone number given to defendant in court).  If the defendant does not qualify for public defender representation, the defendant must complete a Petition for Appointment of an Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency also known as the blue form in order for the court to consider appointing an attorney. 

AIA set.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
